word.entryDescription: in a higher position than something else
word.entryExample: Put the picture above the fireplace.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to play the part of a character in a film, play, etc
word.entryExample: Alex acted in the school play.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the number, street, town, etc where a house or building is
word.entryExample: Don't give your address to somebody you don't know.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: feeling frightened or worried
word.entryExample: Emma isn't afraid of spiders.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a continent between the Mediterranean Sea, the Atlantic Ocean and the Indian Ocean
word.entryExample: Are there lions in Africa?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: at a later time
word.entryExample: I do my homework after school.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the part of the day between morning and evening
word.entryExample: In the afternoon we play sports.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: one more time
word.entryExample: Can I see you again next Friday?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: how old something or somebody is
word.entryExample: Fill in this form with your name and age.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a place where you go to take a plane
word.entryExample: What time do you want me to meet you at the airport?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a creature from another planet
word.entryExample: Are aliens green?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the whole number or amount
word.entryExample: Where did they all go?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the whole day
word.entryExample: My cat likes to sleep all day.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: not a problem
word.entryExample: That's all right, you can read my book.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: in addition
word.entryExample: I have a sister and I also have a brother.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: all the time
word.entryExample: I always drink tea for breakfast.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: very good or something you don't expect
word.entryExample: What an amazing song!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the name we usually give to the country the United States of America
word.entryExample: Megan comes from America.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: having strong negative feeling because something has upset you
word.entryExample: Don't talk to him now, he's angry.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a living thing like a bird, cat or dog
word.entryExample: What's your favourite animal?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: one more
word.entryExample: Would you like another piece of cake?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to reply to
word.entryExample: Kim answers the teacher's question.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a hard round fruit with a thin red or green skin and white flesh
word.entryExample: Apples are my favourite fruit.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the long part of your body between your shoulder and your hand
word.entryExample: First point to your arm, then point to your leg.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a comfortable chair with sides for your arms
word.entryExample: My grandma likes to sit in this armchair and watch TV.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: in your house/ flat
word.entryExample: Is Lucy at home?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: in school
word.entryExample: I learn English at school.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: your mother or father's sister, or their brother's wife
word.entryExample: My aunt lives in the next street.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a very large island between the Indian Ocean and the southern Pacific Ocean, which is both a country and a continent
word.entryExample: Kangaroos come from Australia.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an informal word that means you think something is very good
word.entryExample: That's awesome!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: very young children who cannot walk or talk yet
word.entryExample: We have a new baby sister.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the top half of your body that is behind your chest
word.entryExample: I sleep on my back.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a pain in your back
word.entryExample: I need a new bed because the old one gives me backache.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: not good or of poor quality
word.entryExample: Yesterday was a bad day.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small sign you pin on your clothes containing words or a picture
word.entryExample: My school badge has the name of the school name on it.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: not done well
word.entryExample: Number 12 kicks the ball badly.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a sport two people play with rackets. You hit a light object over a high net on a court
word.entryExample: Badminton is a fun game.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something which you can put things in and carry from one place to another
word.entryExample: I carry my books to school in a bag.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small outside area joined to a room in a flat
word.entryExample: I like to sit on the balcony and drink tea.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a round object that you throw, carry, kick or hit in sport
word.entryExample: Let's play with the ball.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: tall thick tropical grass with young shoots that pandas like to eat
word.entryExample: Pandas eat a lot of bamboo leaves.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a long tropical fruit with a thick yellow skin, and soft white flesh
word.entryExample: Monkeys love bananas.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a business that looks after people's money
word.entryExample: Is there a bank near here?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a team sport in which people hit a ball with a long thin bat and then run around four bases
word.entryExample: Baseball is an American game.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small round hat that fits closely on your head with a round part at the front to keep the sun from your face
word.entryExample: Wear your baseball cap outside in the sun.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the floor of a building below ground level
word.entryExample: We keep our bikes in the basement.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a team sport played on a court in which people bounce a ball and throw it into a round open net
word.entryExample: Ben is tall and he's good at basketball.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a room where you shower and wash or go to the toilet
word.entryExample: Excuse me, where is bathroom?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an area of sand at the edge of the sea
word.entryExample: Kim and Jill are at the beach.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a large strong animal with thick fur and long sharp claws
word.entryExample: Are there any bears in the forest?
word.label: ydp
